fr_title: Kafr Takharim Salqin - 60km west of Aleppo - 14 October 2012
summary_en:
Syrian government airstrike on Kafr Takharim or Salqin in Idlib (or between the neighboring villages) contained a toxic substance that was soft and light, like cotton or spiderwebs. Mosques made public announcements from minarets warning residents not to touch the white substance in the streets.
Based on time of social media posts, the attack occurred around 12:30 Syria time on 13 Oct 2012.
collections.2: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged attacks by syrian goverment forces
title_en: Chemical attack in Kafr Takharim or Salqin, Idlib on 13 October 2012

summary_en: Damascus Suburbs: Harasta: More than 50 cases of shortness of breath, nausea, and fainting were reported after alleged chemical attack by the Syrian goverment forces. Posts about this incident were published on facebook (https://www.facebook.com/search/str/%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%A7%20%D8%A7%D8%AE%D8%AA%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%82%20/stories-keyword/14/nov/2012/date-3/stories/intersect).

Syrian government forces launched an attack with chemical weapons on al Khalidiya or al Bayada in Homs (or between the two neighborhoods). One report indicated the chemical weapon was a nerve agent. Numerous people were injured and brought to a small medical facility for treatment. Many patients suffering from choking and difficulty breathing were treated with oxygen masks, and some patients had their partially clothes removed, which is consistent with treatment for exposure to a chemical weapon. Local sources reported about eight individuals were killed in the attack, by exposure to the chemical weapon.
First tweets reporting the attack were posted around 17:45 Syria time on 23 Dec 2012.
collections.2: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged attacks by syrian goverment forces
title_en: Chemical attack in Homs on 23 December 2013

summary_en:
Pro-Syrian government sources accused opposition forces of firing a missle laden with chemical weapons on Khan al Asal, a town southwest of Aleppo city. SANA reported that the missile fell in a civilian-populated area, about 300 meters from a military location. Pro-government sources and government officials reported 25-31 people were killed in the attack, and 85-110 people were injured, including civilians, children, and soldiers. Russian officials backed up the Syrian government's claims and condemned the attack. SANA also published pictures of people allegedly injured in the attack, receiving treatment in a medical facility.
Alternatively, pro-opposition sources accused Syrian government forces of launching a chemical weapon attack on Khan al Asal. Pro-opposition sources included little details on the the effects of the attack or casualties.
First tweets about the attack appeared at 9:40am Syria time on 19 March 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack in Khan al Asal, Aleppo on 19 March 2013

fr_title: Al-Otaiba - 30 km east of Damascus - 19 March 2013
summary_en:
Syrian government forces launched a chemical attack on al Oteiba on March 19, causing casualties. Victims of the attack, some of whom exibited difficulty breathing, were treated with oxygen masks in a medical facility. At least one patient exibited foaming at the mouth and significant difficulty breathing. Another patient was treated with an IV. At least one person reportedly died from the attack. All patients seen receiving treatment in the medical facility (about five in total) are young men.
First tweets reporting the incident were posted at 8:45am Syria time on 19 March 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack in al Oteiba, Damascus on 19 March 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces bombed Baba Amr neighborhood of Homs with missiles or mortars containing toxic gasses. Ten cases of "suffocation" were reported. No visual sources were found - only tweets and facebook posts.
First tweets appeared around 11:30pm Syria time on 19 March 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack on Baba Amr, Homs on 20 March 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces launched an attack with phosphorous gas in Darayya, Damascus. A victim of the attack, who was coughing, was treated in a medical facility in Darayya with an oxygen mask and an IV or shot. 
First tweets reporting the attack were posted around 9:45am Syria time on 28 March 2013.
title_en: Phosphorous attack in Darayya, Damascus on 28 March 2013

fr_title: Al-Otaiba - 30 km east of Damascus - 9 April 2013
summary_en:
Syrian government forces reportedly shelled Oteiba, Damascus with chemical weapons. Videos show armed men walking around outside low buildings made out of brick and mud and focus in on a number of dead birds lying on the ground, which appear to have been killed in the attack, as they are not displaying traumatic injuries.
First social media posts reporting the attack appeared around 10:00 Syria time on 9 April 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack on Otaiba, Damascus on 9 April 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces reportedly launched chemical weapon attacks on the Kurdish-populated neighborhood of Sheikh Maqsood in Aleppo. A woman and two children were reported killed in the attack. Videos show up to a dozen people lying on beds in a medical facility to receive treatment. Local medical sources reported that victims from the attack suffered from hallucinations, vomiting, excess mucus, and burning eyes. One video shows renmants of the weapon that allegedly contained the chemical agent, which appears to be a mortar or shell.
The timing of social media reports suggest the attack occurred around 1:00am Syria time on 13 April 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack on Aleppo on 13 April 2013

summary_en: Syrian government forces reportedly launched a chemical weapon attack in Darayya, Damascus. The Local Council of Darayya released a statement confirming the attack and reporting on casualties. The statement reported that victims, most of whom were civilians, suffered from shortness of breath, suffocation, burning eyes, and nausea. Cattle and poultry also died in the chemical attack. The local council reported that symptoms victims exibited were consistent with exposure to flourine compounds and sarin. A video shows patients being treated in a small medical facility with oxygen masks and IVs. Two other videos show birds that allegedly died in the attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Darayya, Damascus on 25 April 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces reportedly attacked Adra, Damascus with weapons containing chemical agents. Medical workers clad in protective gas masks and gowns treated patients in medical facility in nearby Douma, Damascus. Many patients were treated with oxygen masks and displayed difficulty breathing. Many patients had their clothes partially removed, and some were washed down with water. A few patients displayed pinpoint pupils, which is a symptom consistent with exposure to a nerve agent. Another patient was foaming at the mouth, which is also consistent with exposure to a nerve agent. A few patients appear to have mild traumatic injuries but most appear to be suffering from non-trauma related injuries. The medical facility is overwhelmed with patients and treating victims on the floor. All patients seen in vidoes are young men.
First social media posts reporting the incident were posted around 10:00pm on 23 May 2013.
title_en: Chemical weapon attack in Adra, Damascus on 23 May 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces reportedly launched a chemical weapon attack on opposition forces located on the international highway between Harasta and Qaboun, Damascus, where they were stationed to fight Syrian government forces. About a dozen videos show people - many young men, but also at least two babies, a child, and a woman - being treated with oxygen masks in a medical facility. Many of the victims have their clothes [artially removed. Many patients are being treated on the floor of the medical facility because there are not enough beds. One victim appears to have pinpoint pupils and tremors in his fingers, both of which are symptoms of exposure to a nerve agent. Al Arabiya reported six people were killed and more than 70 were injured in the attack.
First social media posts reporting the attack appeared around 11:00pm Syria time on 26 May 2013.
title_en: Chemical attack on Harasta, Damascus on 26 May 2013

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Al-Bahariya in Damascus. There's one video showing a victim of the alleged chemical attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Al-Bahariya, Damascus on 9 June 2013

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Zamalka in Damascus. There are two videos from the same uploader showing victims of a chemical weapons attack (https://www.facebook.com/syrienrev.juljula1/videos/136607719876902/) and a witness testemony (https://www.facebook.com/syrienrev.juljula1/videos/137927043078303/). 84 people reported injured and 8 reported killed.
title_en: Chemical attack on Zamalka, Damascus on 23 June 2013

summary_en:
Man is being treated within a medical facility with an oxygen mask. He is coughing
and is in pain. More injured men are being carried up a staircase and into the 
facility. Inside, there is a big room filled with injured men laying on beds awaiting 
medical attention or being treated. They appear to have anywhere from minor to 
severe cuts and burns from being exposed to a chemical agent. In the second video
5-6 men are laying on the ground wrapped in a blanket. They are not moving and 
are lying still.
title_en: Suffocation cases due to heavy bombing with poison gas on Al-Khalidiya on 5 July 2013

summary_en:
Man is being filmed speaking about what he experienced in the chemical 
attack. Another man is foaming at the mouth and experiencing difficulty breathing.
The second video shows medical staff rushing back and forth. Injured men are
being carried in. Young men are laying on hospital beds experiencing trouble 
breathing. One boy's chest appears to be convulsing as a result. Young kids are 
being showered with water by men holding water hose. Lastly, a very young boys
is crying and shouting while doctors try to help him. Another elderly man is yelling 
in pain as the doctor applies pressure to his arm.
title_en: Chemical attack on Duma, Damascus on 08 April 2013

summary_en: More than 1,400 reportedly killed in Syrian chemical weapons attack. Densely populated neighborhoods were attacked with explosions, followed by an oozing blanket of suffocating gas. An intelligence assessment of the chemical attack explained that Syria was behind the release of deadly gas with its effects documented in more than 100 videos. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/nearly-1500-killed-in-syrian-chemical-weapons-attack-us-says/2013/08/30/b2864662-1196-11e3-85b6-d27422650fd5_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.e2f4b12ad244
title_en: Sarin chemical attack on Eastern Ghouta, Damascus on 21 August 2013

summary_en:
Syrian government forces launched an aerial assault on the Jobar region of Northeast Damascus. Airstrikes and artillery attacks caused severe damage and destruction to buildings within the region. Reporters from "Le Monde" explained their findings concerning the toxic arms used by the Syrain government. It has been reported that the chemical attack is hard to detect. "
No odor, no smoke, not even a whistle to indicate the release of a toxic gas. And then the symptoms appear. The men cough violently. Their eyes burn, their pupils shrink, their vision blurs. Soon they experience difficulty breathing, sometimes in the extreme; they begin to vomit or lose consciousness." http://www.lemonde.fr/proche-orient/article/2013/05/27/chemical-war-in-syria_3417708_3218.html
title_en: Chemical attack on Jobar, Damascus on 04 September 2013

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Jobar in Damascus. Videos of this incident show one man being treated as a result of the alleged chemical attack, and another video show one of the medical facility workers talking about the details of the incident.
title_en: Chemical attack on Jobar, Damascus on 12 September 2013

summary_en:
One man is laying on the ground unresponsive. Another man laying down on the
 ground and has a gas mask being put on him. Three men are surrounding him 
attempting to help him breath.
title_en: Chemical attack on Adra, Damascus on 03 March 2014

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Jobar frontline in Damascus. One video of this incident shows a victim being treated as a result of this atatck.
title_en: Chemical attack on Jobar, Damascus on 03 April 2014

summary_en:
The video shows the trail of destruction in two buildings. It also shows a person in 
military uniform as well as someone carrying a weapon. The video shows footage 
in a place appears to be a medical point contains many people, including women 
and children,and the chaos can be noticed in the place. Someone wearing a medical 
uniform appears while providing an oxygen mask to a child. The video also shows two
 people wearing military trousers. The video shows someone wearing an oxygen mask;
 another person stands next to him, who is believed to be a medical staff member, as he 
wears a medical uniform and amedical mask. The video was filmed in a place seems to 
be a medical point. In 
this 18 seconds video, what seems to be a sound of a gunshot can be heard, then
 what believed to be the sound of a falling object from the sky, followed by an
 explosion in the place. The video shows someone sitting on a chair; wearing 
an oxygen mask on his face. The camera then moves to one of the rooms where
 a man and woman appear wearing oxygen masks; the man can be seen wearing
 military trousers. The video appears 
to be filmed in the same place of another video, in what seems to be a medical 
point: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3suhYoXQjA
The video shows what appears to be remnants of a metal cylinder claimed to 
be the remnants of ammunition used in the attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita, Hama on 11 April 2014

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in ِAl Tamanaa in Idlib. One video of this incident posted on facebook shows victims of a chemical weapons attack being treated in a medical facility called Haneen. (https://www.facebook.com/hanen1.2013/videos/505739259532012/). 20 people were effected as  aresult of this attack. The videos seem to indicate that whoever uploaded the video thought it was a chlorine attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Al Tamanaa, Idlib on 12 April 2014

summary_en:
The video shows the trail of destruction in two buildings. It also shows a person in
 military uniform as well as someone carrying a weapon.The video shows footage
 in a place appears to be a medical point contains many people, including women
 and children, and the chaos can be noticed in the place. Someone wearing a
 medical uniform appears while providing an oxygen mask to a child. The video also 
shows two people wearing military trousers. The video
 shows someone wearing an oxygen mask; another person stands next to him, who
 is believed to be a medical staff member, as he wears a medical uniform and a 
medical mask. The video was filmed in a place seems to be a medical point.
 In this 18 seconds video, what seems to be a 
sound of a gunshot can be heard, then what believed to be the sound of a falling 
object from the sky, followed by an explosion in the place. The video shows someone
 sitting on a chair; wearing an oxygen mask on his face. The camera then moves to
 one of the rooms where a man and woman appear wearing oxygen masks; the
 man can be seen wearing military trousers. 
The video appears to be filmed in the same place of another video, in what seems to
 be a medical point: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3suhYoXQjA
The next video contains testimony of a person who
 is alleged to be a doctor about the incident. The video shows what appears to be 
remnants of a metal cylinder claimed to be the remnants of ammunition used in the attack. 
The person who is filming the video can be heard saying that the content of the cylinder
 has been unloaded by the engineering battalion. The video shows a number of people
 stretched out on beds, including an old man, they allegedly have been injured as a result 
of the attack. The video shows someone who appears to have been intubated by medical
 staff members. A person wearing military trousers appears before the camera goes to one of 
the rooms where children have been placed on a bed, showing signs of fatigue. In the same 
room, a number of young people are stretched on the floor and seem to have difficulty breathing,
 as well as other children placed on another bed, and a man laying on a bed. The same room 
appeared in footage in another video:
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-eDHqQIZsDM.
The video continues to show footage from another place where an armed man in military 
uniform appears, as well as some men and women. After that; the camera enters one of
 the rooms where two women are stretched out on two beds, in addition to some people, one 
of them wearing a medical uniform. The camera then turns to another room showing a person
 lying on a bed and provided with an oxygen mask; he can be seen coughing. The video later shows 
footage from a different place; two men, one of them in medical uniform, can be seen as they provide
 medical treatment to women laying on beds. The video was filmed at several medical points, after the incident. The video shows a number of children placed on two beds, some crying.
 On the floor around the beds; a number of people are stretched out; some appear to have difficulty
 breathing, one of them can be seen foaming at the mouth during the attempts to resuscitate him by who seems to be a member of the medical staff. The video also shows a person carrying a child and can be 
seen trying to supply oxygen to him. In the video someone wearing a medical uniform, appears to be a 
doctor, speaks. The video was filmed at a medical point after the incident
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita, Idlib on 12 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in ِJobar in Damascus. One video of this incident shows one man killed as  aresult of this chemical attack. His name is: Ebraheem Darweesh.
title_en: Chemical attack on Jobar, Damascus on 14 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Atshan, around this date. There are two videos from different uploaders near the same date, at the same location, showing likely victims of a chemical weapons attack. The videos seem to indicate that whoever uploaded the video thought it was a chlorine attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Atshan, Hama on 14 April 2014.

summary_en: Videos show victims of a chemical weapons attack that occurred at night, with a video uploader indicating that the attack took place over several days. At least one video uploader appears to believe it was a chlorine attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita, Hama on 16 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tamana'ah. One video posted about this incident shows a victims being treated as a result of the alleged chemical attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tamana'ah, Hama on 18 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in KafrZita. Videos posted about this incident shows victims being treated as a result of the alleged chemical attack. Videos of this incident show remnants of the munitions and gas containers used in this attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita , Hama on 18 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tamana'ah. One of the videos show a witness testemony about this attack. 60 people were effected as a resut of this attack. The witness mentioned that chlorine was used in this attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tamana'ah, Hama on 19 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tall Manissss. One of the videos show remnants of the munition used in this attack. Animals appear dead in the video as a result of the alleged chemical attack. Crater can be seen in one of the videos. More than 100 reported effected as a result of the attack. People being transfered to a medical facility called jarjanaz. One of the videos shows Norinco gas cylinder.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tall Manissss, Idlib on 21 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tamana'ah. One of the videos show remnnats of the munition. 7 people reported to be effected as a result of this attack. Haneen medical facility was treating the victims of this attack. The videos seem to indicate that whoever uploaded the video thought it was a chlorine attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tamana'ah, Hama on 29 April 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in KafrZita. One video about this incident show the impact site of this attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita , Hama on 09 May 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in KafrZita. One video about this incident show the impact site of this attack as well as the remnants of the munition. Two bombs has been mentioned by one of the doctors who works at the medical facility that recieved the injured people.
title_en: Chemical attack on KafrZita , Hama on 19 May 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tamana'ah. One of the videos show remnants of the munition. Injured people in the video were being treated at Haneen medical facility. Videos show children effected as a result of this chemical attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tamana'ah, Hama on 22 May 2014.

summary_en:
Syrian government forces reportedly launched an attack with chlorine gas on Kafr Zita in Hama on 22 May 2014. A video shows a dense mustard-colored gas settled close to the ground on a street lined with small buildings, around dusk or dawn. Men wearing gas masks run towards the gas to assist people running away from the gas while covering their mouths. Additional videos show alleged victims of the attack, most of whom are women and children, receiving treatment in a crowded medical facility. Many patients are coughing and are treated with oxygen masks and IVs. A medical worker treating a small girl says in English that the patients were exposed to toxic chlorine, which was dropped in a bomb from a helicopter. The Hama Media Center reported 20 people were injured in the attack.
There were multiple reports of chemical weapon attacks on Kafr Zita in the days leading up to 22 May 2014.
The first reports of this chlorine attack appeared around 12:15pm Syria time on 22 May 2014. Given the timing of these reports and the lack of sunlight in the videos, the attack likely occurred around dawn, which was at 5:24am on 22 May 2014.
title_en: Chlorine gas attack on Kafr Zita, Hama on 22 May 2014

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Tamana'ah. There's one video that shows a child in Haneen medical facility. One facebook post shows a child being treated (https://www.facebook.com/1abdalghforaldeab/posts/314055728760569).
title_en: Chemical attack on Tamana'ah, Hama on 23 May 2014.

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Erbin, Damascus. The are videos showing victims being treated as a result of this attack.
title_en: Chemical attack on Erbin, Damascus on 05 June 2014.

summary_en: The aftermath of a chemical attack with various casualties. The footage shows a wet man lying down with an oxygen mask on his face, it can be noticed he is exhausted and has difficulty breathing. The video then shows a man who seems to have severe difficulty breathing, and foaming at the mouth. The secretions are being pulled out of his mouth by a suction tube. Another man is shown lying on a bed while someone is trying to revive him. At the end of the video, it shows footage of a person lying over a gurney on the floor while pouring water on his body and the people trying to undress him.
The aftermath of a chemical attack. The incident shows the remains of a barrel bomb
According to Shaam News Network a government aviation dropped a barrel bomb loaded with Chlorine gas on Kafr Zeita, Hama, no injuries were recorded. The videos shows the cluster and no victims.
title_en: Chemical attack in Kafr Zita, Hama, April 10, 2015

summary_en: According to Shaam News Network a government helicopter dropped a barrel bomb loaded with chlorine gas on Tamana, Idlib, no injuries recorded
title_en: Chemical attack in Al-Tamanah, Idlib, April 10, 2015

summary_en: According to the site islahhaber.net the government  dropped 7 barrel bombs loaded with chlorine gas in Idlib, dozend injuries were reported
We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
There is one video related to this incident, the video shows people allegedly had been subjected to a poison gas
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Kafr Awid, Idlib on 26 April 2015

summary_en: The videos which documented this incident show injured people allegedly had been subjected to a toxic gas
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Hwash, Idleb on 26 April 2015

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

According to the White Helmets twitter page (@SyriaCivilDef) there were reports of a chemical attack in Jabal Zawiya, Idlib at 22:00 on 26 April 2015. Barrel bombs were used to drop the toxic substances (allegedly chlorine). There is a post on facebook about the incident posted by 
(جبل الزاوية اليوم Jabal Alzaweya Today) reported that " Many cases of suffocation after targeting the town with two explosive barrels containing chlorine gas. And the transfer of a large number of civilians to field hospitals." https://www.facebook.com/Jabal.Alzaweya.today/photos/a.284965285000629.1073741827.283436698486821/449576168539539/?type=3&theater
We didn't find any videos that verify this incident
title_en: Chemical attack on Jabal al-Zawiya, Idlib 26 April 2015
title_ar: هجوم كيماوي على قرية جوزف جبل الزاوية في ادلب ٢٦ ابريل ٢٠١٥

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

There is a post on facebook about the incident posted by (Ahmad Asaad) reported that "The town of Al-Nairab targeted by chlorine gas for the second time which resulted in 5 cases of suffocation" https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=1439581569685776&set=a.1387677704876163.1073741828.100009018408069&type=3&theater . We didn't find any videos that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Alnairab, Idleb on 27 April 2015

summary_en: There is a post on facebook about the incident posted by (SAS News Agency وكالة ساس نيوز للأنباء) reported that "the Syrian regime helicopters targeted Kansafra village with an explosive barrel containing chlorine gas" https://www.facebook.com/SASNEWSAGENCY/photos/a.733987789978579.1073741828.731915533519138/964651626912193/?type=3&theater. We didn't find any videos that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Kansafra, Idleb on 28 April 2015

summary_en: Reports suggest that government helicopters allegedly dropped at least 2 barrel bombs containing chlorine on Saraqeb in Idlib. Around 12 people, including children, were injured and suffered from suffocation. One video shows a news report about the incident. Another video shows the Idlib Civil Defense Team walking around ruined buildings, collecting samples and documenting the chemical attack.
title_en: Chemical attack in Saraqeb, Idlib 29 April 2015
title_ar: هجوم كماوي على سراقب في ادلب يوم ٢٩ ابريل ٢٠١٥

summary_en: Witnesses reported that helicopters dropped chlorine barrel bombs above Al-Hawash, Hama, and other villages near by. The tweets were made between 10:40 PM on April 29 and 7:30 PM April 30. According to a post on facebook posted by ( مركز حماة الإعلامي Hama Media Center ) "The regime targeted barrel both Hawash and Qastoun villages in the western countryside of Hama with explosive barrels containing chlorine gas " https://www.facebook.com/hama.media.center3/posts/1573895822862771. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Chemical attack in Al Hawash, Hama, April 29, 2015

summary_en: The bombing in Qastoun, Hama, started reportedly around 8 pm April 29, 2015. The first tweets about chlorine barrel bombs were made nearly three hours later around 11 pm and go on throughout April 30. Some of them mention "suffocations" without further deatails or number of victims. In addition, some tweets as well as an article from Syrian news desk (http://syrianewsdesk.org/2015/04/30/3825/) refer to attacks on other villages in the rural area outside Hama like Al-Hawash. A post on facebook posted by ( حماة الآن - Hamah Now ) reported that " Cases of suffocation in the town of Qustoun in the countryside of Hama after being targeted with explosive barrels containing chlorine gas" https://www.facebook.com/Hamah.Now/posts/620298834771806. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Chemical attack in Qastoun, Hama

summary_en: Early morning on May 2, helicopters dropped two barrels with chlorine gas over Saraqib, according to reports. Besides Saraqib, Sarmin and Qastoun were allegedly also targets. It is reported that a large number of children suffered from suffocation, some reports speak about between 70 and 100 injured, at least two people were killed.
title_en: Chemical attack in Saraqeb, Idlib on 2 May 2015

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

The location of the chemical attack was in Al-Janudiyah, Syria which is in northern Syria specifically in the Idlib Governence on May 7th, 2015. According to media articles from the Times of Israel (https://www.timesofisrael.com/syrian-activists-report-new-chlorine-attacks-in-idlib/), ibtimes, newsweek, and human rights watch they reported that provinces in Idlib throughout the battle held in the Northwestern Syria province, chemical attacks had occured and to add the geopolitical element to these attacks, many of these attacks according to Al Jazeera, between the months of April-June 2015, the Assad regime has continously bombarded rebel held areas to weaken their offense and while at the same time, has used chemical weapons in different provinces in the city of Jisr al-Shugour which included, Al-Janudiyah, Al-Bashiriya, and Al-Sarmaniya. These attacks occured around the same days in the month of May 2015 in the city of Jisr al-Shughour. The chemicals were put into multiple barrel bombs that were dropped in multiple villages as mentioned in the beginning. According to the article published by the Times of Israel, 80 people were injured in the attacks which included children who were killed as well as elderly Syrians. Many of the images and documents that conclude these reports were mentioned in the articles by human rights activits on the ground which included images of the weapon and destruction of the cities. Overall, we can infer that the chemical weapons attack was lanuched allegeldly by the Syrian regime throughout the battle between the rebels and government forces in Idilib.
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Al-Janudiyah -Idlib- 07 May 2015

summary_en: According to a post on facebook posted by ( S.N.N | شبكة شام ) : "Helicopters targeted Beshiriya Village with Explosive barrels containing Chlorine Gas" https://www.facebook.com/ShaamNetwork.Arabic/posts/967651849952056. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Al-Bashiriya -Idlib- 10 May 2015

summary_en: The location of the chemical attack was in Al-Sarmaniya, Syria which is in northern Syria specifically in the Idlib Governence which occured on May 10th, 2016. According to media articles from the Times of Israel (https://www.timesofisrael.com/syrian-activists-report-new-chlorine-attacks-in-idlib/), ibtimes, newsweek, and human rights watch they reported that provinces in Idlib throughout the battle held in the Northwestern Syria province, chemical attacks had occured and to add the geopolitical element to these attacks, many of these attacks according to Al Jazeera, between the months of April-June 2015, the Assad regime has continously bombarded rebel held areas to weaken their offense and while at the same time, has used chemical weapons in different provinces in the city of Jisr al-Shugour which included, Al-Janudiyah, Al-Bashiriya, and Al-Sarmaniya. These attacks occured around the same days in the month of May 2015 in the city of Jisr al-Shughour. The chemicals were put into multiple barrel bombs that were dropped in multiple villages as mentioned in the beginning. According to the article published by the Times of Israel, 80 people were injured in the attacks which included children who were killed as well as elderly Syrians. Many of the images and documents that conclude these reports were mentioned in the articles by human rights activits on the ground which included images of the weapon and destruction of the cities. Overall, we can infer that the chemical weapons attack was lanuched allegeldly by the Syrian regime throughout the battle between the rebels and government forces in Idilib. According to a post on facebook posted by ( تنسيقية مدينة بنش ) :" Syrian regime warplanes targeted Sarmanya and Basheryia Villages in Idleb countryside with chlorine gas" https://www.facebook.com/ramiooooove.page/posts/1583575851908699. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Al-Sarmaniya -Idlib- 10 May 2015

summary_en: According to a post on facebook posted by ( الناشط أبو اليمان الحموي) : " Helicopters targeted the town of Aqrab with two barrels contain chlorine gas, causing several suffocations among civilians " https://www.facebook.com/aboualyaman11/posts/1597411343832586. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Aqrab -Hama- 14 May 2015

summary_en: The location of the chemical attacks in Idlib was in the town of Mashmashan and the date of the attacks took place on May 15th, 2015. According to media articles from the Times of Israel (https://www.timesofisrael.com/syrian-activists-report-new-chlorine-attacks-in-idlib/), ibtimes, newsweek, and human rights watch they reported that provinces in Idlib throughout the battle held in the Northwestern Syria province, chemical attacks had occured and to add the geopolitical element to these attacks, many of these attacks according to Al Jazeera, between the months of April-June 2015, the Assad regime has continously bombarded rebel held areas to weaken their offense and while at the same time, has used chemical weapons in different provinces in the city of Jisr al-Shugour which included, Al-Janudiyah, Al-Bashiriya, and Al-Sarmaniya. These attacks occured around the same days in the month of May 2015 in the city of Jisr al-Shughour. The chemicals were put into multiple barrel bombs that were dropped in multiple villages as mentioned in the beginning. According to the article published by the Times of Israel, 80 people were injured in the attacks which included children who were killed as well as elderly Syrians. Many of the images and documents that conclude these reports were mentioned in the articles by human rights activits on the ground which included images of the weapon and destruction of the cities. Overall, we can infer that the chemical weapons attack was lanuched allegeldly by the Syrian regime throughout the battle between the rebels and government forces in Idilib. We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Mashmashan -Idlib- 15 May 2015

summary_en: The video which related to this incident shows a place alleged to be the site of the attack and remnants of the ammunition used in the attack
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Sarmeen -Idlib- 16 May 2015

summary_en: According to a post on facebook posted by ( أحمد نور الرسلان ) : 40 cases of suffocation as a result of the attack on the villages of Qastan and Mashmashan with chlorine gas https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1408281289496245&id=100009431616220. We didn't find any videos that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Qastan -Idlib- 17 May 2015

summary_en: According to a post on facebook posted by ( المركز الصحفي السوري ) : The Syrian regime used chlorine gas again in the village of Mashmshan https://www.facebook.com/syrianpresscenter/videos/1614872602088678/. We didn't find any videos that verify this incident
title_en: Alleged Chemical attack on Mashmashan -Idlib- 17 May 2015

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

The video was filmed in a place seems to be a medical point. It shows a number of 
men, some of them stretched out on medical beds, some sitting on chairs. They are 
supplied with oxygen masks. They were allegedly injured as a result of the alleged 
chemical attack. The video also shows a person wearing white clothes appears to
 be special protective suit, he can be seen while taking photos of the injured. In the
 same place, a number of people appear, some of whome seem to be members of the 
medical staff.
Casualties of the chemical attack on Harasta

The incident begins in a hospital room with what appears to be a news presenter telling the narrative of the incident. The camera then flashes to outside the building where it appears to be sunset. It then flashes to chemical remains from a chemical attack. The news presenter then interviews medical staff or personell in the hospital. The camera then shoots to the outside and a young boy is holding his nose and gesturing to something that the camera does not point to. The video is captured by Orient news. The other video begins by facing the bottom corner of a wall which appears to have been destroyed as there is a hole. The camera then shoots to a medical personnell sitting at a desk talking to the camera. The camera then goes to the outside of the room where the hole is much larger and a man points to it describing what has happened.
no videos in database - need to discovery
This incident is in a hospital room where a boy is being treated for what appears to be a chemical attack.
The incident is the aftermath of a chemical attack. A young man is being washed after what appears to be a chemical attack and taken to a hospital room.
The incident is injured people receiving first aid.

According to the Human Rights Watch https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo and Bellingcat https://www.bellingcat.com/news/mena/2016/12/19/the-cl2-before-the-storm/ on 18 November 2016 between 8 and 9 am, government helicopters dropped 5 barrel bombs containing chlorine on the districts of Masaken Hanano and Ard al-Hamra in Eastern Aleppo. The Aleppo Civil Defense recorded that 12 people were injured by the attack, including an old woman and several children. Witnesses recall smelling chlorine moments after the bombs were dropped, and reported seeing yellow smoke rising from the areas of the attack. A video posted by Orient News shows some of the injured in a makeshift hospital receiving treatment [dc29bc28]. Another video posted by the AMC shows remnants of a yellow cylinder barrel bomb dropped during the attack [f67c19bc]. Other videos posted by SMART and خاص الجسر show the destruction in the neighborhoods affected and include witness testimonies [3b8cec5f] and [8f17471f].
title_en: Chemical Attack on the Districts of Masaken Hanano and Ard al-Hamra in Eastern Aleppo on 18 November 2016

summary_en: According to the Syrian Network for Human Rights http://sn4hr.org/wp-content/pdf/english/the_Syrian_Regime_Uses_Chemical_Weapons_Again_en.pdf, on 20 November 2016 at 01:15 am, the al-Sakhour neighborhood in Eastern Aleppo was hit by two barrel bombs containing chlorine dropped by government helicopters. A family of six suffocated to death, including a woman and four children, as seen in this video posted by the AMC [e5cae351]. No physical signs of injury on the deceased, however their faces tuned blue and their eyes were popping out. According to HRW, another 25 people were injured https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo.
title_en: Chemical Attack on al-Sakhour neighborhood in Eastern Aleppo on 20 November 2016 ends in civilian casualties

summary_en: A video of the attack on 22 November 2016 at 16:30 on the Dahrat Awwad area in the Tareeq al Bab neighborhood in Eastern Aleppo posted by the AMC shows the moment of the attack [695082c9]. A helicopter is seen hovering over the and a cloud of green smoke emerges between buildings. According to the HRW, around 15 people were injured in the attack https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo.
title_en: Chemical Attack on Dahrat Awwad neighborhood in Eastern Aleppo on 22 November 2016

summary_en: The event likely occurred on 20 November 2016 in Tariq al-Bab. According to Bellingcat, around 16:30 a helicopter dropped a chlorine cylinder near Al-Helwanyeh in the Tariq al-Bab district https://www.bellingcat.com/news/mena/2016/12/19/the-cl2-before-the-storm/. A video posted by the Syrian Institute for Justice and Accountability on 22 November 2016 shows ruined buildings and shows the remnants of a yellow chlorine cylinder [6b040038]. Later in the video, you can hear the sound of bombs in the background. Another video posted by AMC on 23 November 2016 shows a closer view of the remnants of the weapon https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=36&v=gGrUcxZ3YeM.
title_en: Chemical attack on Tariq al-Bab district in Aleppo on 20 November 2016

summary_en: On 23 November 2016 around 22:00, regime helicopters dropped two barrel bombs containing poisonous gas, possibly chlorine, on al-Jazmati and Ard al-Hamra neighborhoods. According to Orient News, 13 people were injured in these two districts combined http://orient-news.net/ar/news_show/127541/0/الأسد-يخنق-أطفال-حلب-بغاز-الكلور-السام. One video shows a witness testifying, claiming that his neighbor, a 55-year old woman, was killed in the attack [04aa4163]. Another video shows the remnants of a yellow cylindrical bomb used to carry out the attack [d437d3fe].
title_en: Chemical Attack on al-Jazmati and Ard al-Hamra neighborhoods on 23 November 2016

summary_en: On 25 November 2016, the Sheikh Maqsoud district, populated mainly by Kurds, was reportedly shelled by Islamic opposition groups at 19:12. According to ARA News, the attack was carried out by Ahrar al-Sham and Jabhat Fateh al-Sham, killing 6 individuals and injuring 15 https://web.archive.org/web/20170418081739/http://aranews.net/2016/11/syrian-islamists-launch-chemical-attack-on-kurdish-district-in-aleppo/. Victims reportedly suffered from suffocation, burning skin, and vomiting, which are symptoms that coincide to the exposure of mustard gas. A video on the Syrian Archive shows a victim receiving treatment in a makeshift hospital.
title_en: Attack on the Sheikh Maqsoud district of Aleppo on 25 November 2016

summary_en: According to the Human Rights Watch https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo, on 28 November 2016 the Aleppo Media Center and Shah News Agency reported about chlorine attacks on Karam al-Qaterji and Qadi Askar. Munitions dropped on a playground in a public park. Firas Badawi, a photographer with the AMC who witnessed the incident, noted that there was yellow-green smoke and a strong smell of chlorine. Around 11 to 12 people were injured and experienced symptoms of difficulty breathing, a loss of consciousness, pain in their chests, coughing, burning in the eyes, and foaming from their mouths. Another 11 people were injured after the gas was carried with the wind, and two people possibly died during the attack. Another witness claims a helicopter dropped an object near a cemetery in Qadi Askar at 3pm and about 20 people were injured and transported to hospitals for treatment.
title_en: Chemical Attack on the Karam al-Qaterji and Qadi Askar neighborhoods of Aleppo on 28 November 2016

summary_en: According to Human Rights Watch, between 4 and 5 pm on 8 December 2016, chlorine attacks on Kalaseh and Bustan al-Qasr were reported by the AMC and Shah News Agency https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo. HRW suggests that these claims refer to three chlorine munitions that struck al-Maghayer neighborhood in the Bab al-Maqam district, al-Fardous, and Kalaseh. A witness to the event claimed the first attack struck, followed by another strike close to al-Hayat medical clinic in Kalaseh. Around 50 people, including 20 children were injured and experienced shortness of breath, foam exerting from the mouth, dizziness, headaches, and drowsiness. Al-Hayat clinic took in 70 patients for treatment. One witness claims two people were killed in the attack.
title_en: Chemical Attack on Kalaseh neighborhood in Aleppo on 8 December 2016

fr_title: Bustan Al-Qasr- Near Central Aleppo- 8 December 2016
summary_en: A city located in the Aleppo governate called Bustan Al-Qasr, a once rebel held area now controlled under the Syrian regime, the city had been bombarded with intesne force by the Syrian regime thousands of families were forced to leave from their homes. Bombings in Bustan Al-Qasr started on December 8th, 2016. The victims of the bombardment in Bustan included children, women, and in general many were inncocent civillans.  The purpose of the attack by the Syrian government was try to take over Aleppo to gain territorial control back to the Syrian government. Acorrding to a report from the New York Times (https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/09/world/middleeast/syria-aleppo-united-nations.html) , many had been imprisoned, tortured, and bodies lying on the street from constant bombardment by the regime. Furthermore, some of the innocent civillans throughout the conflict between the government and rebel forces had either reported that the rebels would prohibt civilains from leaving the city and some stated that they actually allowed civillians to flee. According to a report from the Gaurdian (https://www.theguardian.com/world/gallery/2016/dec/13/eastern-aleppo-as-pro-assad-forces-move-in-in-pictures), they have documented multiple images of Syrians from Aleppo which includes the city of Bustan Al-Qasr, showing women and children fleeing from their homes due to constant clashes between the syrian and rebel forces. Thus, we can assume that the constant bombardment that was perputrated by the syrian regime has forced many to flee from their homes, displacing them and as to the reports that were mentioned, many innocent civillans were killed, imprisoned, tortured, etc. by the syrian forces.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Bustan Al-Qasr neighborhood, Aleppo on 8 December 2016

summary_en: The location of this Massacre is Al-Firdous which is located in Aleppo. The continous bombardment and attacks from the Syrian regime started in early December 6th, 2016. There was also usage of chemical weapons by the syrian regime according to the human rights watch (https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo), the chemical weapons used were chlorine gas from the video provided by the Human Rights Watch. According to numerous reports specifically by Aljazeera (http://www.aljazeera.net/news/arabic/2016/12/12/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%8A%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%B5%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%81-%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AD%D9%84%D8%A8), mass executions had been occuring in the town of Al-Firdous since December 6th 2016. Many bodies filled the streets from constant bombardment in which the town was besiged making it difficult for inccocent villians to flee from bombs falling from russian and syrian helicopters. The victims of the masacre were inncocent people that ranged from children, the elderly, women, also rebel fighters. Footage of the massacre is provided by the White Helmets ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ghIjs2vFk0) as well as photograghs and more video footage by al jazeera (http://www.aljazeera.net/news/arabic/2016/12/12/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%8A%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%B5%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%81-%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AD%D9%84%D8%A8). The footage provided by the White helemts shows multiple bodies that are deaceased from shellings and with Al Jazerra's footage, many women were fleeing from Aleppo and the video captured the destruction caused by the shellings. Moreover, we can infer based on media collection of the massacre, video caught footage, and images of the destruction post-shelling that these attacks were allegedly perpeturated by the syrian regime and their allies which includes russia and hezzbollah.
collections.1: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged russian attacks
collections.2: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged attacks by syrian goverment forces
collections.3: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged attacks by pro-syrian goverment forces
title_en: Alleged chemical Attack on Al-Fardos neighborhood in Aleppo on 8 December 2016

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

The location of this chemical attack took place in Al-Kalasa located in the city of Aleppo. The chemical attack occured in December 9th 2016. According to a USSOM report (http://www.uossm.org/breaking_chemical_weapons_attack_in_kallaseh_aleppo), they concluded that reports of chemical attacks from the use of chlorine gas, a choking agent, were targeted on innocent civillians in Kalasa. The Human Rights Watch also reported chemical weapons attack in the town of Al-Kalasa on December 9th, 2016 (https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo). The report by USSOM, provided a google drive of three videos that provides more explicit information on the chemical attacks that took place. In all three of the videos provided, there were a few children who were injurded by the chlorine gas and getting care from the doctors as well as the women. The doctors were shown treating the children who were attacked by the chlorine gas as well for the elderly women shown in the video. In the human rights report, they showed images of continous chemical weapons that were used in cities around aleppo and these yellow cylinders were filled with chlorine gas which was the chemical used in the town of Al-Kalasa. Furthermore, we can infer that based on the evidence provided by the USSOM report of videos showing the after math of the attacks as well as the report from the Human Rights Watch that the syrian government was allegeldy behind the the chlorine attacks in Al-Kalasa.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Kalaseh neighborhood, Aleppo on 9 December 2016

fr_title: Bustan Al-Qasr- Near Central Aleppo- 12th December 2016
summary_en: The city of Aleppo, Bustan Al-Qasr, there were reports of chemical weapons attack, the use of chlorine attacks allegdly by the Syrian government forces attacking the rebel-held areas. This took place on December 12th, 2016. According to a bellingcat report (https://www.bellingcat.com/news/mena/2016/12/19/the-cl2-before-the-storm/) , they uploaded photos and sources from medical centers in the city of Bustan Al-Qasr called, Bustan Al-Qsar Medical Center. They reported from those medical centers that many inoccent had been targeted; children, women, and genreally inncocent cilvillans in the city. The weapon as described by the bellingcat report and from a report from the Human Rights Watch (https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/02/13/syria-coordinated-chemical-attacks-aleppo) , the chlorine attack was dropped by gas cylinders filled with chlorine dropped from a helipcopter. The reports as mentioned, provided pictures of the children who were attacked, videos of the chemical weapons being dropped from helicopters and their aftermath of the bombs being dropped. Moreover, we can infer that these attacks were perputrated by the Syrian government in the previously rebel-held area of Bustan Al-Qsar which has injured and killed numerous inncocent civillains.

Civil Defense workers in the southern Aleppo neighborhood of al-Kallaseh reported a government chlorine attack on the evening of January 10 December. The chemical attack was reportedly delivered by barrel bomb from a government helicopter. Video from a medical point in al-Hayat showed dozens of civilians suffering from suffocation [d283da32]. This attack appears to be the same as the al-Hayat chlorine attack entry HAC101216. (https://www.facebook.com/B.Q.MEDICAL.CENTER/posts/1019917998117981)
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Kalaseh neighborhood, Aleppo on 9 December 2016

summary_en: On December 12th, 2016 a neighborhood in East Hama, Uqayribat, the district was attacked with chemical weapons that were dropped by war planes. According to the Human Rights Watch report (https://www.hrw.org/report/2017/05/01/death-chemicals/syrian-governments-widespread-and-systematic-use-chemical-weapons), they recieved information from the locals of the neighboorhood reporting that there were war planes dropping the chemical weapons and that ot was done by the syrian and russian regime. This neighboorhood had a strong ISIS hold as well so many of the locals stated that they weren't allowed to document the chemical attacks because of fear from the Islamic State. According to Al Arabi's report (https://www.alaraby.co.uk/politics/2016/12/12/%D9%82%D8%AA%D9%84%D9%89-%D9%88%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D8%AE%D8%AA%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%82-%D8%A8%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%81-%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%B3%D9%8A-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D8%B1%D9%8A%D9%81-%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D8%B1%D9%82%D9%8A) they reported that many civillians in neighborhoods of East Hama suffucated because of the chemical weapons which were linked to be Sarin gas according to the media report. Going back to the Human Rights Watch report, 67 locals died from the chemical attacks and these were noted by medical charity workers on the ground, on ground activists, etc. Furthermore, reports by the Human rights watch and well established media reports collected on the chemical attack in Eastern Hama conclude that the attacks were allgedly done by the syrian and russian regime in order to combat the Islamic State that has a strong hold in eastern Hama even though many pf the attacks had harmed numerous innocent civillians.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Aqayribat town, Hama on 12 December 2016

summary_en: On January 3rd, 2017, a town in the city of Damascus, Wadi Barada, it was reported by the new arab (https://www.alaraby.co.uk/english/news/2017/1/5/poison-gas-used-in-regime-attacks-on-wadi-barada) that the syrian regime had deployed chemical weapons and had also cutt water supply of the town. That same week, on January 8th and 9th 2017, the syrian regime had deployed more chemical weapons, specifically chlorine gas. According to the Human Rights Report (https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/report_pdf/syria0517_web_3.pdf) they provided witness testimonies of the locals who lived in the village. Dozens of innocent civillans were injured or dead. Furthermore, based on the reports provided from the new arab and from the human rights watch, we can concluded that assads regime allegedly used chemical weaons on its own people in chances of winning the territory against the rebels.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Ashrafiat Wadi Barada town, Damascus on 03 January 2017

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Bassimah in Damascus. There is a post on facebook about the incident posted by ( Halab Today TV) reported that "Warplanes launch rockets containing chlorine poison gas on Bassimah town in Wady Barada, Damascus countryside." https://www.facebook.com/HalabTodayTV/posts/1632993296718102
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Bassimah town, Damascus on 05 January 2017

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Bassimah in Damascus. There is a post on facebook about the incident posted by ( Halab Today TV) reported that "Warplanes launch rockets containing chlorine poison gas on Bassimah town in Wady Barada, Damascus countryside.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Bassimah town, Damascus on 08 January 2018

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Marj al sultan in Damascus. There are two videos related to this incident, show the remains of ammunition claimed to have been used in the attack
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Marj al sultan town, Damascus on 30 January 2017

summary_en: Videos posted by local sources show Syrian warplanes bombarding the city of Arbin in Rif Dimashq province in Damascus. A video posted on social media documents first responders removing a deceased infant from the rubble.
title_en: Chlorine Gas Attack on Arbin on February 7, 2017

summary_en: The Syrian regime bombed the city of Arbin in Rif Dimashq province in Damascus with chlorine gas on February 9, 2017, for the second time in less than a week. The city was also bombed with chlorine gas the next day. Human Rights Watch reported that three combatants were injured as a result of the attack. Bellingcat conducted a detailed investigation of the February 9 attack using local sources and cited one reported casualty. Qasioun News Agency reports that victims were transported to a hospital in Arbin, and a reporter interviewed a medical professional on staff. Video footage posted by local sources document victims at the hospital experiencing convulsions, difficulty breathing, and foaming at the mouth.
weather: Fog, partly cloudy, few clouds, average 7.2 degrees celsius
title_en: Chlorine Gas Attack on Arbin on February 9, 2017

summary_en: The Syrian regime bombed the city of Arbin on February 10, 2017, with chlorine gas for the third time in less than a week. Videos and images posted by local sources show victims suffering from difficulty breathing and foaming at the mouth. One image shows a child with difficulty breathing receiving medical attention, and another shows a deceased child. Human Rights Watch reported that three combatants were injured as a result of the attack. The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs has marked the attack as strongly presumed to involve the use of chlorine by the Syrian regime.
weather: Partly cloudy, few clouds, 7.78 degrees celsius
title_en: Chlorine Gas Attack on Arbin on February 10, 2017

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Housh Al Dawahrah in Damascus. The videos related to this incident show the remains of ammunition claimed to have been used in the attack, and contain many testimonies about it.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Housh Al Dawahrah town, Damascus on 20 February 2017

summary_en: Local sources report that regime planes bombarded the town of Harasta on February 26, 2017 with poisonous gas, causing breathing difficulties and suffocation among civilians, including children. The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs listed the attack having a strong presumption of the use of chlorine gas by the Syrian government. Images posted to social media document victims, including an infant, suffering from breathing difficulties and receiving medical attention.
title_en: Chlorine Gas Attack on Harasta on February 26, 2017

summary_en: On March 25, 2017, a Syrian air force helicopter dropped an improvised chlorine barrel bomb on Latamneh Surgical Hospital in Hama, injuring at least 32 people and killing 3 civilian men. The attack has been confirmed independently in investigations using witness testimony and open-source materials by a United Nations Commission of Inquiry, Human Rights Watch, Bellingcat, the New York Times, and the University of California Berkeley Human Rights Investigations Lab in partnership with the Syrian Archive. The Syrian Archive has twelve videos associated with this incident in the database.
title_en: Chlorine Gas Attack on al-Lataminah Hospital on March 25, 2017

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in Qaboun in Damascus. The videos which documented this incident show injured people allegedly had been exposed to a toxic gas.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Qaboun, Damascus on 29 March 2017

summary_en: At approximately at 6:30am on March 30, 2017, a Syrian air force warplane dropped two bombs with Sarin gas south of the village of Al-Lataminah. The attack has been confirmed independently in investigations using witness testimony and open-source materials by the UN Organization of the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons Fact-Finding Mission in Syria, the United Nations Commission of Inquiry on Syria, Human Rights Watch, Bellingcat, the New York Times, and the Human Rights Investigations Lab in partnership with the Syrian Archive. The Syrian Archive has eight videos associated with this incident in the database. Although the UN Commission of Inquiry on Syria reported 85 injured individuals, including 12 farmers, Human Rights Watch reported 169 injured, many of them possibly combatants.
title_en: Sarin Gas Attack on the al-Lataminah countryside on March 30, 2017

summary_en: Around 6:45am, a Sukhoi 22 aircraft, a warplane operated only by Syrian forces, dropped three conventional bombs and one chemical bomb in Khan Shayhoun in Idlib.  The UN Commission of Inquiry of Syria  reports that the chemical bomb, strongly presumed to contain sarin gas, killed at least 83 people including 23 women and 28 children, and injured another 293 people, of which 103 were children. Human Rights Watch reported 92 deaths and hundreds injured. Injuries comprise symptoms expected of exposure to sarin gas, such as breathing difficulties, loss of consciousness, foaming at the mouth, and irritation. Investigations by the Organization of the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons Fact-Finding Mission in Syria, Human Rights Watch, and Bellingcat, among other groups, have conducted separate investigations into the attack.
title_en: Sarin Gas Attack on Khan Sheykoun on March 30, 2017

summary_en: A chemical weapons attack appears to have occurred in latamneh in Hama. The videos documented this incident show what is claimed to be bombing the city with barrel bombs.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Latamnh, Hama on 6 April 2017

summary_en: We didn't find any visual documentation that verify this incident

One video from Ruptly shows an explosion near a water tower among many buildings. It appears to be filmed from a window. it then shows a rifle shooting from a window slit, but the target is not visible. It also shows machinery inside a building that is shooting out of what appears to be a slit. Due to lighting, neither the machinery nor the target are visible. Next, it shows a group of 6 armed men running through rubble. It returns to a shot of a rifle shooting towards buildings and rubble through what appears to be either a window or car with iron bars. It gives a snippet of a plane flying and then army men loading bombs, ending on an explosion behind a mound of dirt near a telephone tower. There is also a tweet stating "Faylaq al-Rahman reports regime chlorine use on the Ein Terma front, where the regime has recently had trouble in its advance attempts" from John Arterbury(https://twitter.com/JohnArterbury/status/881176064386617345). The Washington Post, among other sources, state the Syrian rebel group Faylaq al-Rahman accused the Syrian Army of using chlorine gas (30 people allegedly suffered from the attacks), while the Syrian Army denied vigorously.
title_en: Alleged chemical attack on Ayn Tarma, Damascus on 01 July 2017

summary_en: Aletihad press reports that the regime forces used a poisonous hand grenade containing chlorine gas during battles between the opposition forces and the regime forces on the front of Zamaleka http://aletihadpress.com/2017/07/02/قوات-النظام-تستخدم-غاز-الكلور-في-قصف-زم/ . Sources report that several patients have been brought to local field hospitals with symptoms of suffocation which aligns with the inhalation of a poisonous gas.
title_en: Chemical Attack on Zamalaka neighborhood of Damascus

summary_en: The Joubar neighborhood of Damascus was allegely attacked chorine gas on the first of July. This was part of the Ein Tarma attack that effected Zamalka and Ein Terma as well as Joubar http://orient-news.net/ar/news_show/138343/0/قوات-الأسد-تقصف-جبهة-عين-ترما-بمادة-الكلور
title_en: Chemical Attack on Joubar the neighborhood of Damascus

summary_en: Multiple reports of government chlorine attacks on Faylaq al-Rahman fighters emerged in the first days of July amid ongoing clashes in the Ayn Tarma, Zamalka, and Jobar suburbs of Damascus. While there are no sources directly implicating a chlorine attack in Ayn Tarma on July 2, several sources depict the attack on the suburb on July 1 as noted in entry ETA010717. Faylaq al-Rahman released a statment on July 1 claiming their fighters were attacked with chlorine and released a video interview with a commander on July 4. The German Welt newsite published an article on July 22 citing western intelligence sources confirming a chlorine attack against Faylaq al-Rahman fighters in Ayn Terma on July 1.

un_title: 2 July 2017| Zamalka| Chlorine used against faylaq ar-rahman fighters, who suffered from red eyes, hypoxia, rhinorrhoea
summary_en: Reportedly, the discrict of Zamalka was attacked three times using chlorine poisonous gas. Most sources, such as Al-arabi and Al-jazeira, claim the government forces responsible for the attack. Victims experienced symptoms of saffocation, unconcioussness, cramps. Some children were also among the victims. The videos from Alrahmancorps https://twitter.com/Omar_Madaniah/status/881593047619862529 https://youtu.be/2pHPUuSItz8 and Info Dar-aliman https://youtu.be/eIA36t6YSZc seem to be screened at the same facilities.

Sources, such as Shaam Network www.shaam.org/news/syria-news/بعد-فشلها-في-التقدم-قوات-الأسد-تستهدف-جبهات-عين-ترما-بـ-الكلور-السام.html and the Syrian Network for Human Rights http://sn4hr.org/blog/2017/08/14/45499/ , report of an offensive on 4 neighboring distrcits of Damscus, one including Jobar. SNHR reports that the offensive and its chemical attacks took place "between mid-June 2017 -the period of time when the Syrian regime forces started their military escalation in Damascus and Eastern Ghouta- and July 31, 2017.

un_title: Zamalka - Chlorine used against Faylaq al-Rahman fighters in Damascus on three ocassions: 46 fighters suffered from red eyes, hypoxia, rhinorrhoea, spastic cough, and bronchital secretions. Perpetrator: Syrian Government.
summary_en: Al-Arabiyya reported multiple attacks in the region around July 6 (www.alaraby.co.uk/politics/2017/7/7/النظام-يخنق-محيط-دمشق-خطة-لتطويق-جوبر-وتهجير-القلمون). This is corroborated by the UN, which lists chemical attacks in Idlib on July 5, 6, and 7. Al-Arabiyya reported that the District of Jopar's medical office in Damascus treated a number of patients, from the July 6 attack, who inhaled toxic gases after the bombartment by the Assad regime. Al-Arabiyya reports, "the office explained that the symptoms included shortness of breath, coughing, naseau, heartburn, stressing that the patients were exposed to toxic gases, likely chlorine."  Further corroborating the event, a tweet posted by the verified account @HoseinMortada reports of an agressive Syrian offensive in Zamalka from July 5- 7(https://twitter.com/HoseinMortada/status/882913477152710656).

18 NOV 2018| HARASATA| a number of wespons were dropped with 25 fighters suffreing from a combination of symtoms incl. blurred vision, unconsciousness, contracted pupils, shortness of breath, nasel secretions, vomiting & headaches

fr_title: Southern Aleppo - Southern Aleppo - 10 December 2016 - Strong presumption of the use of chlorine by the Syrian regime
summary_en: Civil Defense workers in the southern Aleppo neighborhood of al-Kallaseh reported a government chlorine attack on the evening of January 12 and morning of January 13. The chemical attack was reportedly delivered by barrel bomb from a government helicopter. Video from a medical point in al-Hayat showed dozens of civilians suffering from suffocation [d283da32]. This attack appears to be the same as the al-Hayat chlorine attack entry HAC101216 and was listed by the French MFA as "strong presumption of the use of chlorine by the Syrian regime.

Local sources reported a government chlorine attack delivered by three "Golan" surface-to-surface rockets on opposition-held Duma, Damascus, at 6:10am. The Health Directorate in the countryside of Damascus claimed that six patients suffering from suffocation were treated at the Damascus Specialist Hospital in East Ghouta. At least one victim appeared to be a child. Victims exhibited signs of minor respiratory disorder, respiratory failure and agitation.

Government forces injured 20 civilians, including women and children, in a chlorine attack delivered by IRAMS in the besieged city of Duma, Damascus. U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson confirmed the attack and casualties in a statement on January 23, 2018 in which he referred to "more than 20 civilians, mostly children, were victims of an apparent chlorine gas attack.

The chemical attack, according to an Amnesty International report, occurred on 4 Feb. 2018 (https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/02/syria-witness-testimony-reveals-details-of-illegal-chemical-attack-on-saraqeb/). SMAART news, corroborated by the Syrian Civil Defense, purpots that 2 barrel bombs filled with chlorine gas dropped on the civilian populated area of Saraqib, outside of Idlib (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qhG7elxN7B4). The Syrian Civil Defense reported symptoms of irratated skin and eyes, vomiting, and collapse according to the Amnesty report. This chemical attack attracted a lot of foriegn media including a corroborating comment from the US D.O.S. (https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2018/02/277992.htm).
collections.2: Civilian casualties as a result of alleged attacks by syrian goverment forces
